title: Workshop on Forming Practitioners’ Mathematical Identity Through Calculus

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: A course where current practitioners explore the practical applicability of calculus in language education, strengthen mathematical confidence, and emphasize situated learning using smartphone-based collaborative tools and everyday examples.

learning_goals: Learners can model real workplace problems using calculus-based approaches.
Learners can utilize peer feedback in mathematical problem-solving processes through collaborative projects.
Learners can concretely explain the impact of calculus on their specialized field (language education).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
